## MM-T4384: Test-App valid open_full_form_modal command

---

**Step 1 from MM-T3907: Setup the test-app**

<!-- (Auto-generated) Note: The following step/s in Step 1 should not be updated here. Instead, modify directly to the referenced MM-T3907 test case. -->

_**Step 1.1**_

Deploy the test locally\
1\. Pull down the repo mattermost-app-test at https\://github.com/larkox/mattermost-app-test\
2\. Start the test app by running _make runÂ _in the command line

_**Expected**_

Terminal shows:\
_go build -o dist/mattermost-app-test\
LOCAL=true ./dist/mattermost-app-test http\://localhost:3000 :3000_

_**Step 1.2**_

Install the test-app\
1\. Type _/apps install url http\://localhost:3000/manifest_\
2\. On the dialogue that opens, check the box for _Agree to grant the App access to APIs and Locations _and enter_ 1234 _as the JWT secret

_**Expected**_

App is installed

_**Step 1.3**_

Change the channel to load bindings

_**Expected**_

Test app is now available

---

**Step 2**

1\. Open a channel where the slash command bindings are available\
2\. Type _/test valid open\_full\_form\_modal_\
3\. Select 2 static options\
4\. Add some text\
5\. Scroll down and check the boolean then click submit

**Expected**

On 2. The test app open a modal\
On 5. The following is displayed as expected (listed top to bottom)\
\- Static options selected\
\- Table with emojis\
\- Red Error text\
\- Text input box\
\- Title and formatted text\
\- Code block\
\- Emoji and animated gif\
\- Quote text\
\- Image and link\
\- List and numbered list\
\- Read-only check list with error text\
\- Selectable boolean\
\- "Marked field" with red text\
\- Big error text below submit\
